summary: This document is a chain of emails from August 2020 discussing the planning of a meeting between the Department of Justice and victims of Jeffrey Epstein. It involves coordination between FBI Victim Services personnel and a DOJ official responsible for coordinating contact with victims.

events.title: Planning for Victim Meeting
events.description: The Department of Justice is in the early stages of planning a meeting with the victims of Jeffrey Epstein. An email chain coordinates scheduling a call to discuss the best way to proceed.

events.title: Scheduled Coordination Call
events.description: A calendar invite is sent for a call scheduled from 3:30-4:30 p.m. to discuss planning for victim contact.

keyFacts: In August 2020, the DOJ was actively planning to meet with victims of Jeffrey Epstein, indicating ongoing victim outreach years after his death.
The coordination involves the FBI Victim Services Division and the DOJ's National Child Exploitation & Human Trafficking Coordinator.
The document shows structured inter-agency communication (FBI and DOJ) regarding victim assistance for the Epstein case.
Multiple roles are described but the individuals' names are redacted, including a Victim Specialist, a Program Manager, and an Associate Deputy Attorney General.
